ctl:suite.name: sps:suite
ctl:suite.ctl:title: SPS 2.0 Compliance Test Suite
ctl:suite.ctl:description: Verifies that an SPS 2.0 implementation complies with the SPS 2.0 specification.

ctl:test.name: sps:Main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The IUT satisfies all applicable assertions.

body.h2: Compliance Test Suite for Sensor Planning Service (SPS) 2.0
body.p: Please provide a URL from which a Capabilities document can be retrieved. Modify the URL template below to specify the location of an OGC SPS 2.0 implementation to be tested.
Please select how tho send request.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Executing tests on the SPS implementation found at the following URL:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: Missing or invalid response entity.

ctl:test.name: sps:ows-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "ows" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the ows module.

ctl:link.title: 1. OWS

ctl:test.name: sps:general-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "general" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the general module.

ctl:link.title: 2. General

ctl:test.name: sps:general-SPS.General-InvalidRequest.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Sending a request that is non-conformant to a schema associated with an SPS operation causes the server to return a valid error report message with an exceptionCode value of InvalidRequest.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Send several test documents that are invalid according to the schemas associated with some of the SPS operations (i.e. the mandatory operations). Pass if the service returns a valid exception message with an exceptionCode value of InvalidRequest; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that an invalid request produces an appropriate response from the server.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Skip "InvalidRequest" Exception Test because CTL cannot send InvalidRequest body with soap-binding.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid request, or the response from the server was not a valid exception report. The response from the server was: ""

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking the validity of the response to an invalid request.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to an invalid request was expected to be an exception report with an exceptionCode of "InvalidRequest" and a locator value containing the validation issue. The returned exception report was: ""

ctl:test.name: sps:general-SPS.General-ValidResponse.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: A response is a valid response for the SPS. This general assertion should be tested by all other tests.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Tested through other tests.

ctl:link.title: Verify that a response entity is schema-valid

ctl:code.ctl:message: This general assertion is tested by all other tests, so there is nothing specific to test now.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-main
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All assertions for "core" conformance are satisfied.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Test driver for the core module.

ctl:link.title: 3. Core

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a valid GetCapabilities request to
The server responded to a valid GetCapabilities request with the following message:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to a valid GetCapabilities request, or the response was not a valid SPS Capabilities document.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Execute GetCapabilities Test.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if all the subtest not fail; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles missing parameters correctly.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of MissingParameterValue when mandatory parameters are missing from the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains MissingParameterValue; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles missing parameters correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return responses to the GetCapabilities requests in this test, or the responses to these requests were not valid exceptions.

xsl:if.ctl:message: Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with no request parameter.

FAILURE: The server did not return the expected exception report response to a GetCapabilities request with no request parameter specified. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "MissingParameterValue" and a locator of "REQUEST". "" was returned instead.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestServiceParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of InvalidParameterValue when the service key value is not SPS.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains InvalidParameterValue; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid service key values correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service value of ""
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return or a response, or the response was not a valid exception report.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service value.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid service parameter () does not match the expected response. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "InvalidParameterValue" and a locator value of "SERVICE".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-KVPRequestRequestParameterHandling.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with an exception code of InvalidParameterValue or OperationNotSupported when the request key value is not GetCapabilities.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the exception report is valid and the exceptionCode parameter contains InvalidParameterValue or OperationNotSupported; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles invalid request key values correctly.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Issuing a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request value of ""
The server returned the following response:

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return or a response, or the response was not a valid exception report.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Checking the validity of the response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request value.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The response to a GetCapabilities request with an invalid request parameter () does not match the expected response. The response was expected to be an ExceptionReport with an exceptionCode of "InvalidParameterValue" or "OperationNotSupported".

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseOperationMetadataMandatoryOperations.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The OperationsMetadata section lists the mandatory operations of the SPS.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the service lists the GetCapabilities, DescribeSensor, DescribeTasking, Submit, GetStatus, GetTask and DescribeResultAccess operations with the proper bindings in the OperationsMetadata section; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the OperationsMetadata section advertises the mandatory operations of the SPS.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The GetCapabilities operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeSensor operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeSensor operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.
FAILURE: The DescribeTasking operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeTasking operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.
FAILURE: The Submit operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The Submit operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.
FAILURE: The GetStatus operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The GetStatus operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.
FAILURE: The GetTask operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The GetTask operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.
FAILURE: The DescribeResultAccess operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, it must be listed in the OperationsMetadata section of the GetCapabilities document.
FAILURE: The DescribeResultAccess operation is a mandatory operation. Therefore, a URL must be supplied for the HTTP POST binding for this operation. No URL was supplied for this binding.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseOperationMetadataOptionalOperations.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Any non-mandatory operations advertised in the OperationsMetadata section have valid SPS method names.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the service lists operations in addition to the mandatory operations, and each of the advertised operations has a valid SPS operation name; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that any non-mandatory operations listed in the OperationsMetadata section are valid SPS operation names. This is still up for debate and will probably not be part of the final tests.

ctl:code.ctl:message: Verifying that the provided operations have valid SPS operation names.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The "" operation is not listed in the SPS specification.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: is a valid SPS operation name.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseSPSContect.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: There must be a minStatusTime in SPSContect tag, and there are one or more supportedEncoding which value is designated .
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if 1.SPSContent has just one sub-element "minStatusTime" 2.SPSContent has one or more sub-element "supportedEncoding" 3.sub-element "supportedEncoding" have only three Specified choice.

ctl:link.title: SPSContect.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: There can be only one minStatusTime element.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: At least one supportedEncoding element in SPSContent.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The value of supportedEncoding "" is not allow.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.GetCapabilities-ResponseContentsSensorOfferings.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Each SensorOffering sub-element (procedure, procedureDescriptionFormat, observableProperty, and observableArea) has a value. There are one byPoint or one byPolygon in observableArea.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if each sub-element of a SensorOffering element has a value; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that each SensorOffering has appropriate values for its sub-elements.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The procedureDescriptionFormat value for SensorOffering is null.
FAILURE: The procedureDescriptionFormat value for SensorOffering is null.
FAILURE: The AreaOfService value for SensorOffering is null.
FAILURE: The observableArea value for SensorOffering is null.
FAILURE: There are at least one PointOrPolygon in observableArea. "sps:byPoint" or "sps:byPolygon" choose one.
FAILURE: The PointOrPolygon in observableArea can only have one. "sps:byPoint" or "sps:byPolygon" choose one.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: OK: The validity of SensorOffering in contents is ok.

ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the GetTask response are correct; fail otherwise.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid GetTask request or the response was not a valid exception.
FAILURE: It must have a "sps:task" element in the response of the GetTask.
FAILURE: It must have a "sps:Task" element in the element "sps:task" in the GetTask response .
FAILURE: It must have a "swes:identifier" element in the GetTask response and the element value equal to task value from the GetTask request.
FAILURE: It mush have at least one sps:status in the GetTask response.
FAILURE: There must be one and only one "task" element in the GetStatus response.
FAILURE: There must be one and only one "procedure" element in the GetStatus response.
FAILURE: There must be one and only one "requestStatus" element in the GetStatus response.
FAILURE: The element value of "requestStatus" should be "Pending", or "Accepted", or "Rejected".
FAILURE: There must be one and only one "updateTime" element in the GetStatus response.

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Check Ok: The status in the GetStatus response for the task:"" procedure:"" is valid.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: Execute DescribeResultAccess Test.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if all the subtest not fail; fail otherwise.

ctl:link.title: Verify that the server handles missing parameters correctly.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-RequestNoService.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The server returns a valid error report message with a value of MissingParameterValue for the exceptionCode parameter when no service is supplied in the request.
ctl:test.ctl:comment: Pass if the server return a valid Exception response; fail otherwise.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The server did not return a response to an invalid DescribeResultAccess request or the response was not a valid exception.

xsl:if.ctl:message: FAILURE: The returned exception report was expected to contain an exceptionCode of InvalidParameterValue and a locator of procedure.

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-CheckResponse
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: The response of DescribeResultAccess is valid.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: There must be one and only one element:"sps:availability" in the response of the DescribeResultAccess.[=]
FAILURE: There must be one and only one element in sps:availability : "sps:available" or "sps:unavailable".[=]
FAILURE: There must be one or more "sps:dataReference" in the element:"sps:DataAvailable".[=]
FAILURE: There must be one and only one element:"sps:ReferenceGroup" in "sps:dataReference".[=]
FAILURE: There must be one and only one element:"sps:unavailableCode" in "sps:unavailable".[=]
FAILURE: The value of the element:"sps:UnavailableCode" shall be "DataNotAvailable" or "DataServiceUnavailable".[=]

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Passed: the test of DescribeResultAccess Response with element:"sps:availability/sps:unavailable" is valid.[=]

ctl:test.name: sps:core-SPS.DescribeResultAccess-ReferenceGroup.1
ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All ReferenceGroup is valid in DescribeResultAccess response for a DescribeResultAccess request with procedure or task.

xsl:when.ctl:message: FAILURE: The number of attribute:Title in the Reference or ServiceReference is zero or one .[=]
FAILURE: The number of attribute:Title in the Reference or ServiceReference is zero or one .[=]
situaction 1.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Metadata element in the Reference must be one or more.[=]

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Check OK: This ReferenceGroup is valid .[=]

xsl:when.ctl:message: situaction 2.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Metadata element in the ServiceReference must be one or more.[=]
FAILURE: The number of RequestMessage element or RequestMessageReference element in the ServiceReference must be one.[=]

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Check OK: This ReferenceGroup is valid .[=]

xsl:when.ctl:message: situaction 3.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Metadata element in the Reference must be one or more.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Format element in the Reference must be zero or one.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Abstract element in the Reference must be zero or one.[=]

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Check OK: This ReferenceGroup is valid .[=]

xsl:when.ctl:message: situaction 4.[=]
Check OK: This ReferenceGroup is valid .[=]
situaction 5.[=]
FAILURE: The number of Format element in the Reference must be zero or one.[=]

xsl:otherwise.ctl:message: Check OK: This ReferenceGroup is valid .[=]

ctl:test.ctl:assertion: All ReferenceGroup is valid in DescribeResultAccess response for a DescribeResultAccess request with procedure or task.
